data: Ensure anaphylaxis kit at bedside prior to initiating Iron Sucrose Infusion

Intravenous therapy may be initiated when there is:
severe anemia with hemoglobin less than 110 g/L AND [ferritin less than 30 mcg/L OR transferrin saturation less than 20%]
AND
failure of oral iron therapy trial OR intolerance to oral iron therapy
AND
inadequate iron absorption OR
continued blood loss OR
urgent surgery in an iron-deficient patient/pre-operative indication OR
chronic kidney disease
Test dose is not required for iron sucrose
For patients LESS than 35 kg: Total iron deficit = [body wt (kg) x (130 g/L - actual Hb (g/L) x 0.24] + 15 mg/kg
For patients Greater Than or Equal to 35 kg: Total iron deficit = [body wt (kg) x 150 g/L -atual Hb (g/L) x 0.24] + 500 mg
